awd_titl_txt: The Traveling Electronic Classroom -- A Planning Grant
awd_abstract_narration: 9454198  Friedman    The New York Hall of Science, in conjunction with the Computer  Museum and the Oregon Museum of Science and Industry, is developing  further the "Traveling Electronic Classroom" project concept.  The  project has the goal of introducing parents, teachers, and the  general public to ways in which new technologies can support  educational reform.  Activities in the planning phase include:    o  Convening the Advisory Board to review and refine the project    o  Defining more precisely the target audiences and strategies for      reaching parents, teachers, and underserved populations    o  Performing additional front-end analysis of project need    o  Reviewing known studies of the impact of workshops and exhibits      in introducing new educational technologies    o  Defining further the exhibit surround and exhibition    o  Developing strategies for continuously updating the exhibition    o  Developing further the workshop components    o  Developing detailed evaluation plans
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
